title: Global Thermostat unveils design with top engineering firms for a Direct Air Capture system that can scale to capture ... - PR Newswire
summary: Global Thermostat has developed a Direct Air Capture carbon dioxide removal system that is scalable and cost-effective, aiming to address carbon sequestration demands and achieve climate targets.
green_innovation: TRUE. This innovation aligns with environmental sustainability goals by directly capturing CO2 from the atmosphere to reduce greenhouse emissions and combat climate change.
business_innovation: TRUE. Global Thermostat's Direct Air Capture technology represents a new and significantly improved process for the company, differentiating it in the market and enabling the development of scalable carbon removal solutions.
green_product: FALSE. The text focuses on a carbon capture technology process rather than a tangible product designed to reduce its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: TRUE. The Direct Air Capture technology described in the article is a green process in manufacturing that minimizes environmental impacts by reducing carbon emissions and promoting sustainability.

title: Kingspan launches hemp-based HemKor as part of its sustainability programme - RIBA Journal
summary: Kingspan launched three hemp-based insulation products blending hemp with recycled jute bags and meeting European standards for bio-based products. These products have significant bio-based contents and thermal performance capabilities, with plans for Environmental Product Declaration certificates in 2024.
green_innovation: TRUE. This is a green innovation as it involves the development and introduction of new environmentally sustainable hemp-based insulation products that contribute to decarbonisation and the use of bio-based materials.
business_innovation: TRUE. It is a business innovation as Kingspan has introduced new hemp-based insulation products that significantly differ from its previous offerings and have been brought to the market, showcasing innovative product development.
green_product: TRUE. These hemp-based insulation products qualify as green products as they are designed and manufactured to significantly reduce environmental impact throughout their life cycle, utilizing environmentally benign materials and sustainable production processes.
green_process: TRUE. The development and production of hemp-based insulation products by Kingspan using renewable and bio-based materials, sustainable processes, and resource-efficient technologies align with the definition of green processes aimed at minimizing environmental impacts.

title: Mine land remediation drives demand for Hemp Farms Australia - Business News Australia
summary: Hemp Farms Australia is seizing opportunities in the industrial hemp market by selling hemp seed domestically and expanding into the US market, particularly with climate-focused products like carbon sequestration and biochar. The company is strategically positioned to dominate both the Australian and US markets with its fibre and dual-purpose genetics, attracting interest from investors and aiming for growth through partnerships and capital raise.
green_innovation: TRUE. This article discusses how Hemp Farms Australia is focusing on climate-conscious products like carbon sequestration, biochar, and industrial hemp genetics, contributing to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE. Hemp Farms Australia is introducing innovative products like hemp-based concrete, pallets, and activated carbon solutions, differing significantly from traditional products and processes.
green_product: TRUE. Hemp Farms Australia's products, such as hempcrete, biofuels, and net zero carbon pallets made from hemp fibre, are designed and used in ways that significantly reduce environmental impact throughout their life cycles.
green_process: TRUE. The article highlights how Hemp Farms Australia's processes aim to minimize environmental impacts by focusing on phytoremediation, carbon sequestration, and sustainable farming practices.
